impact-statement: Inactivation of the <italic>Dictyostelium</italic> orthologue of the tumour suppressor Neurofibromin (NF1) enables amoebae to ingest dissolved nutrients using macropinocytosis more rapidly, and to prey on larger organisms using phagocytosis.

competing-interest.conf1: The authors declare that no competing interests exist.

aff4.dept: Institute of Biological, Environmental and Rural Sciences

aff2.dept: Centre for Human Development, Stem Cells and Regeneration

contribution.con1: GB, Initiated the project, Isolated axenic mutants, Prepared sequencing libraries, Analysed sequence data, Engineered knockout mutants and other strains and characterised them, Wrote the paper
contribution.con2: DT, Helped to characterise knockout mutants and other strains
contribution.con3: SPS, Helped to isolate axenic mutants, to analyse sequencing data, and to characterise knockout mutants and other strains
contribution.con4: DMV, Provided unpublished reagents, Helped to characterise knockout mutants and other strains
contribution.con5: JAP, Initiated the project, Produced sequencing libraries
contribution.con6: RRK, Initiated the project, Isolated axenic mutants, Wrote the paper
